trigger-manually.name: Trigger Manually
trigger-manually.description: If enabled, the edit effect will only trigger when you press the 'Trigger Edit Effect' keybind (V by default, can be changed in Custom Keybinds' menu). Disables all other input settings below, as they're unnecessary then.

enable-button.name: Enable Manual Button
enable-button.description:
If enabled, adds a button to the game's UI that allows you to manually trigger the edit effect. 
Requires Manual Trigger to be enabled, as this is specifically a mobile alternative to the keybind!
enable-button.enable-if-description: Requires Manual Trigger to be enabled!

edit-rarity.name: Rarity
edit-rarity.description:
How rare the edit effect is on every click. AKA, the chance of it appearing.
- Lower rarity: Higher chance of it appearing.
- Higher rarity: Lower chance of it appearing.

only-after.name: Only After %
only-after.description:
Controls after what percentage can the edit start happening. 
<cy>TIP:</c> If you want the effect to only happen at ur last click/at the end of the level, set this to a higher value like 98% and set rarity to 0.

only-before.name: Only Before %
only-before.description: Controls before what percentage can the edit start happening. This setting along with the Only After % setting allow you to choose the percentage range in which the edit can happen.

mod-mode.name: Trigger Mode
mod-mode.description:
Controls when is the mod's effect triggered. 
- On Click: Triggers the effect right as you click. 
- On Release: Triggers the effect right as you let go of your click.

effect-duration.name: Effect Duration
effect-duration.description:
How long the edit effect (grayscale, image, sound) should last before automatically resuming. 
Max is 5 seconds for everyone's sanity.

action-delay.name: Action Delay
action-delay.description: Controls the delay between your chosen action and when the edit effect will happen. Setting it to 0.5 will wait for 0.5 seconds after you click/release before showing the effect.

action-cooldown.name: Action Cooldown
action-cooldown.description: Controls the cooldown between edit effects in seconds. Exists to avoid the edit effect spamming too much to the point where stuff can easily break.

assets-title.name: Assets Manager
assets-title.description: <cg>Manages which assets to include in the mod.</c> Enable/Disable the mod's own assets and your own as you please!

include-builtin-images.name: Include Built-in Images
include-builtin-images.description: Enables/Disables including <cy>the mod's built-in Images</c> on the list of Images that can show up on the Edit Overlay.

include-custom-images.name: Include Custom Images
include-custom-images.description:
Enables/Disables including <cp>your Custom Images</c> on the list of Images that can show up on the Edit Overlay. 
To add custom images, create a folder called 'images' in the Mod's config folder and place all your custom images there! 
To access the mod's config folder, click the Folder button with a gear on it at the bottom right corner of this Popup. Only .png files are supported. 

Please make sure your file names DON'T contain any special characters!!!

include-builtin-sounds.name: Include Built-in Sounds
include-builtin-sounds.description: Enables/Disables including <cy>the mod's built-in Phonk SFXs</c> to the list of Sounds that can play when the Edit effect is active.

include-custom-sounds.name: Include Custom Sounds
include-custom-sounds.description:
Enables/Disables including <cp>your Custom Music/SFXs</c> to the list of Sounds that can play when the Edit effect is active. 
To add custom sounds, create a folder called 'phonk' in the Mod's config folder and place all your custom sounds there! 
To access the mod's config folder, click the Folder button with a gear on it at the bottom right corner of this Popup. Supported file formats are: 
- .ogg 
- .mp3 
- .wav 

Please make sure your file names DON'T contain any special characters!!!

input-title.name: Input Settings
input-title.description:
Settings to control which inputs activate the effect. 
<cy>TIP:</c> If you want to disable the mod's effects without disabling/uninstalling the whole mod, just disable all 3 settings under this category.

allow-jumpbtn.name: Jump Button/Action
allow-jumpbtn.description: Counts the <cj>Jump Button/Action</c> as one that can trigger the effect.

allow-leftbtn.name: Left Button/Action
allow-leftbtn.description: Counts the <cj>Left Movement Button/Action</c> (Platformer) as one that can trigger the effect.

allow-rightbtn.name: Right Button/Action
allow-rightbtn.description: Counts the <cj>Right Movement Button/Action</c> (Platformer) as one that can trigger the effect.

misc-title.name: Misc Settings
misc-title.description: Other settings for other features of the mod.

enable-wspeed.name: Enable W Speed Texts
enable-wspeed.description: Toggles On/Off showing a text on screen describing literally anything you're doing, similar to the 'W Speed' edit memes.

button-pos.name: Manual Button Position
button-pos.description:
Controls where the Manual Trigger Button appears on screen. 
- Bottom Left: Bottom Left Corner 
- Bottom Right: Bottom Right Corner 
- Top Left: Top Left Corner 
Top Right is not available due to very easily conflicting with the Pause button, sorry.
button-pos.enable-if-description: Requires Manual Trigger Button to be enabled!

hide-on-complete.name: Hide Overlays on Level Complete
hide-on-complete.description:
If enabled, what remains of the edit effect (grayscale, image, sound) will be forcibly removed when you complete the level, in case it was still active. 
 Why is this a setting if it's a fix, u might ask? 

Cuz it's honestly pretty funny to see the sprites remain on screen lol.
